text: Symphony Hour is a 1942 American animated short film produced by Walt Disney Productions and released by RKO Radio Pictures. The cartoon depicts Mickey Mouse conducting a symphony orchestra sponsored by Pete. The film was directed by Riley Thomson and features music adapted from the "Light Cavalry Overture" by Franz von Supp√©. The voice cast includes Walt Disney as Mickey, Billy Bletcher as Pete, and John McLeish as a radio announcer. It was the 117th short in the Mickey Mouse film series to be released, and the second for that year. ==Cast== *Mickey Mouse: Walt Disney *Sylvester Macaroni (Pete): Billy Bletcher *Goofy: Pinto Colvig *Radio Announcer: John McLeish Donald Duck and others have no dialogue in film. ==Production team== ;Principal animation *Jack Campbell *Les Clark *George De Beeson *John Elliotte *Ed Love *Jim Moore *Kenneth Muse *Riley Thomson *Bernard Wolf ;Effects animation *Joseph Gayek *Jack Manning *Ed Parks ==Home media== The short was released on May 18, 2004 on Walt Disney Treasures: Mickey Mouse in Living Color, Volume Two: 1939-Today. ==References== ==Other websites== *
title: Symphony Hour
